```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(lemon)

```


# Introduction

## Level 2 heading example

# Getting the data

```{r}

data <- read_delim("Data/database.csv")

data <- data %>% rename(
  "Social" = `Social media`
)

filtered <- data %>% 
  group_by(Social) %>% 
  filter(Year==min(Year)|Year==max(Year))

```

# Chart construction

```{r}
#CREATE COLOR SCALE
colors <- c("Youtube" = "#bf4538", "Facebook" = "#23689a", "Instagram" = "#6c9acf", "Pinterest" = "#747a46",
            "Linkedin" = "#c2c88e", "Snapchat" = "#746a7c", "Twitter" = "#d1aa42", "Whatsapp" = "#253a5c",
            "TikTok" = "#e9a03f", "Reddit" = "#92885a", "Nextdoor" = "#e28377" )


data %>% ggplot() +
  aes(Year, Use) +
  geom_line(aes(group=Social, color=Social), linewidth= 1) +
  geom_point(data = filtered, aes(color=Social),
             size = 2, shape = 21, fill="white", stroke = 1.5) +
  scale_color_manual(values = colors) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = NULL,
    limits=c(2012, 2021.2),
    n.breaks = 10,
    labels = function(x) paste0("´", substr(x, 3, 4))
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    name = NULL,
    limits=c(5, 95.5),
    breaks = c(20, 40, 60, 80, 100),
    labels = c("20" = "20", "40" = "40", "60" = "60", "80" = "80", "100" = "100%")
  ) +
  theme(
    axis.ticks.x.bottom = element_line(color = "grey"),
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(colour = "grey", linetype = "dotted"),
    panel.grid.minor.y = element_line(colour = "grey", linetype = "dotted"),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"),
    legend.position = "none",
    axis.text.y.right = element_text(color = colors),
    axis.text.x.bottom = element_text(color="grey"),
    axis.text.y.left = element_text(color="grey"),
    axis.line.x.bottom = element_line(color="grey"),
    axis.ticks.length = unit(0, "pt"),
    axis.ticks.length.x.bottom = unit(5, "pt"),
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0),
    aspect.ratio = 1/1.6,
    plot.subtitle = ggtext::element_markdown()
  ) +
  #gghighlight::gghighlight(use_direct_label = T, line_label_type = "sec_axis") +
  labs(title = paste("Growing share of Americans say that they use Youtube;", 
"Facebook remains one of the most widely used online",
"platforms among U.S. adults", sep="\n"),
       subtitle = "*% of U.S. adults who say they ever use ...*",
       caption = 
       paste("Note: Respondents who did not give an answer are not shown. Pre-2018 telephone poll",
       "data is not available for Youtube, Snapchat and Whatsapp; pre-2019 telephone poll data is",
       "not available for Reddit. Pre-2021 telephone poll data is not available for TikTok. Trend",
       "data is not available for Nextdoor.",
       "Source: Survey of U.S. adults conducted Jan. 25-Feb. 8, 2021.", 
       "Social media use in 2021",  sep="\n")) +
  coord_capped_cart(bottom = 'both')

```
